Description: Sleep quality

Description: Well-being

Description: Well-being

Description: Mindfulness

Carotid artery reactivity (acute stress challenge/cold pressor test)
Activity
Description: Questions about current activity

Description: Pleasantness of most significant recent event and anticipation of upcoming event

Name: Mood
Description: Questions about current mood

Description: Questions about recent substance use

Description: All sections combined

Name: Ions, such as calcium, potassium, sodium, magnesium
Salivary cortisol levels (short term; two baseline samples, sample before, immediately after and 20min. after actute stress challenge)
Cell count and white blood cell differential
Exposure to chemicals in the surrounding environment
T1w 3D MPRAGE
Description: Anatomical scan

Name: rfMRI
Description: Resting-state functional scan followed by resting-state questionnaire

Name: rfMRI registration
Description: Resting-state registration data

Name: mfMRI
Description: Movie functional scan

Name: Fieldmap
Description: Auxiliary scans

Name: Diffusion-weighted imaging scan
Description: Structural connectivity characterizations and white matter tissue microstructural modelling

Name: High-resolution T1w 3D MP2RAGE anatomical scan
Description: Quantitative T1 and cortical myelin mapping

Name: High-resolution T2*w scan
Description: Quantitative T2* and magnetic susceptibility mapping for identification and quantification of iron deposition across the brain

Name: Foraging task
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Measure: The tendency to explore alternatives vs. to exploit a chosen alternative
Description: Participants are presented with a tree and have to decide whether to harvest it for apples and incur a short harvest delay or move to a new tree and incur a longer travel delay

Name: Serial random-dot motion discrimination
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Measure: How predictions from the past are weighted with uncertain sensory information in the present
Description: Participants judge the motion direction of moving dots (up vs. down) and receive auditory feedback about the correctness of their response

Name: Reward-driven reach-adaptation
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Measure: How willing people are to search for more rewarding outcomes in a motor task
Description: Participants make shooting movements toward a target while holding a handle that records pulling and hand rotation movements

Name: Paired associate memory
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Description: Participants memorize the associations between pictures of people and names in a study phase and the memory for these associations is tested in a test phase using a cued-recall-test

Name: Tower of London
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Description: Participants are presented with a startling array of different colored, same-sized balls and are requested to move the balls one-by-one, with as little moves as possible to a predefined goal array.

Name: Contextual fear generalization (behavioral data)
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Measure: Behavioral data, avoidance tendency, contingency awareness
Description: Participants are instructed to attend to the presented stimuli and learn to predict the shock in multiple contexts while assessing eye-blink startle electromyography, subjective report, and avoidance tendencies.

Name: Contextual fear generalization (physiological data)
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Description: Participants are instructed to attend to the presented stimuli and learn to predict the shock in multiple contexts while assessing eye-blink startle electromyography, subjective report, and avoidance tendencies.

Name: Emotion regulation task (behavioral data)
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Description: Participants are asked to actively regulate their emotions while either neutral or aversive pictures are presented on the computer screen

Name: Emotion regulation task (physiological data)
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Description: Participants are asked to actively regulate their emotions while either neutral or aversive pictures are presented on the computer screen

Name: Self-referent encoding
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Description: Participants endorse and memorize positive and negative words

Name: Stimulus-response compatibility
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Description: Participants are presented with pictures (alcohol vs. soda) and are instructed to approach or avoid a certain condition

Name: Columbia card task
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Description: A card game that gives participants the repeated choice between risky options and safe options

Name: Food auction
Table Name: Cognitive, affective, and behavioral assessments on campus.
Measure: Reliable index of people's preference for hedonic (short-term reward) vs. healthy food (long-term reward)
Description: Participants bid on different food items (e.g., package of M&Ms, apple)

Name: Over-the-counter medication
Measure: Use of nonprescription medication like pain relievers, cough suppressants, etc.

Name: Health complaints
Measure: Complaints like tiredness, nausea, back pain, headache, etc.

Name: Self-Report Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology
Measure: Presence and severity of depressive symptoms

Name: Multidimensional scale of Perceived Social Support
Exposure to work
Measure: Working hours, working schedules, type of employment

Name: Questionnaire on the Experience and Evaluation of Work
Political efficacy
Measure: Attitude towards national government and politics

Name: BIG-5 NEO-FFI-3
Measure: Openness to experience, conscientiousness, neuroticism, extraversion, and agreeableness

Name: Graph literacy
Measure: Ability to understand the meaning of graphs

Name: Cultural intelligence
Measure: Ability to relate and work effectively across cultures

Name: Higher-order risk preferences - processed data
Measure: Risk attitudes, prudence, and temperance in financial decision-making

Name: Higher-order risk preferences - full data
Measure: Risk attitudes, prudence, and temperance in financial decision-making

Name: Narrative reading
Measure: Comprehension of and immersion into a narrative

Name: Meta-cognition
Measure: Comprehension of and immersion into a narrative
